724755f-a.text:
134-36 and 124-32 White Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of Baxter Street (right) as viewed northward across a
portion of the new Criminal Court site.
View No. 2 is northward on Baxter Street from Bayard Street (extreme right) and shows mainly the 6 story structure (No. 134-36)
that is directly at the corner.
June 10, 1938.
View 2:June 12, 1938.
P. L. Sperr
724755f-a.folder: White Street & Baxter Street, Manhattan, NY

724752f-a.text:
(1)
White Street, west from but not including Baxter Street.
September 24, 1927.
P. LC sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date.
Pebruary 25, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A view of the lower portion of No. 131-33 White Street (also bears No. 76-82 Baxter Street) being at the S.W. corner, as shown on the left of Views 1 and 2. This will be included in the demolition necessitated by plans for the new Criminal Courts Building
and will form the northeastern corner of sage.
November 6, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

724752f-b.folder: White Street & Baxter Street, Manhattan, NY

724753f-b.text:
White Street, north side, from Baxter (richt) to Centre (left) Rtreets, as viewed northward across the cleared site for the new Criminal Corts (and prison) Bldg. This incorporates two square blocks which have just been cleared and are bounded by Centre,east to Baxter, and Leonard, north to White Streets. fhru the center runs Franklin Street. The photographers vantage point in No. 1 is Leonard Street, while in No.2 he is on Baxter Street. To the
left in the latter instance, is Columbus Park.
June 10, 1938.
View 2: June 12, 1938
P. L. Sperr
724753f-b.folder: White Street & Baxter Street, Manhattan, NY
